channel.title: Help compiling and running a server
channel.description:
Hello, Today i downloaded the Project exile source and im having some problems. I open the folder and went to the one called project exile (i think its the source one), the Run was there i edit it so it would locate to my java folder, i could run it and it was fine it said loaded 22138 items and stayed there. The problem comes when i go to the client folder and there were 4 things (to run) run tom, run alex, compile tom,compile alex. I edited the 4 of them with my java location folder and when i run them i had 4 different problems (1 with each) so in the end it wasnt working for me. Here i leave the pictures so if someone knows why this is can help me.
Pd: I have already changed the PATH to my java folder on the system properties advanced.
[img]http://imageshack.com/a/img547/8391/ftrl.png[/img] [img]http://imageshack.com/a/img577/5418/gq5x.png[/img] [img]http://imageshack.com/a/img834/4757/vmyl.png[/img] [img]http://imageshack.com/a/img850/2319/0qjs.png[/img]
Thanks, help really appreciated!

item.title: Help compiling and running a server
item.dc:creator: @john220 john220
item.description:
@john220 wrote:

so how to i do it in eclipse or what is the easiest solution?

Read full topic
item.source: Help compiling and running a server

item.title: Help compiling and running a server
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

The Web Guy:

Usually means your computer doesn’t have enough available RAM to initialize the VM. Either close RAM heavy programs, or set the -Xmx512 to use less RAM. For future reference, run needs to point to Java, compile needs to point to JDK.

Actually the first one could be because he’s not allocating enough RAM. So ‘-Xmx512’ would be wrong. You’d want to run about a gig’s worth.
-Xmx1024

Read full topic
item.source: Help compiling and running a server

item.title: Help compiling and running a server
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

First error I think means that you do not have enough RAM (to allocate whatever you decided to, to the JVM). The second one tells you that Client could not be found, right click->edit and make sure it’s referencing the correct path to the client class (and casing). Third seems like a script which looks in a given directory for javac (ie c:/prog x86/java/1.8_01/bin/) - probably written for the other coder who could not set his PATH variables, you wont need this one. The final states that src\Animable.java is not a directory, i think you’re using javac wrong - perhaps paste it for us.

Read full topic
item.source: Help compiling and running a server
